item.title: Chapter2
item.author: shichen.wang@gmail.com (S Wang)
item.description: Statistical Learning What is statistial learning Suppose we observe a quantitative response $Y$ and $p$ different predictors, $X_1, X_2, \ldots,X_p$ . We assume that there is a relationship between $Y$ and $X=(X_1, X_2,\ldots,X_p)$, which can be written as $$ Y=f(X)+\epsilon $$ Here $f$ is some fixed but unknown fucntion of $X_1,X_2,\ldots,X_p$, and $\epsilon$ is a randome error term, which is independent of $X$ and has mean zero. In this formulation, $f$ represents the systematic informationa bout $X$ provides about $Y$.
